definitions.definition: the process of building or creating something again that has been damaged or destroyed:
examples: Post-war economic reconstruction in the country must begin with the resumption of agricultural production.

definitions.definition: an attempt to get a complete description of an event using the information available, or an attempt to repeat what happened during the event:
examples: A dramatized reconstruction of the robbery was shown on television to try to make people remember information that would help the police.
